questions.question: What is the main product formed when acetone reacts with nitric oxide in the presence of sodium ethoxide at room temperature?
questions.answer: The main product is sodium methanetris(diazene-N-oxide-N‘-hydroxylate).

questions.question: What are the products formed from the reaction of nitric oxide with 3,3-dimethylbutan-2-one in the presence of NaOH and KOH?
questions.answer: The products are sodium and potassium 3,3-dimethylbutan-2-one-1,1,1-tris(diazene-N-oxide-N‘-hydroxylate), respectively.

questions.question: What determines the product formed in the reaction of acetone with nitric oxide?
questions.answer: The product formed depends on the stoichiometry of substrate to base, the temperature, and the time of the transformation.

questions.question: What is the role of the base in the reaction of nitric oxide with acetone and 3,3-dimethylbutan-2-one?
questions.answer: The base promotes the reaction of nitric oxide with acetone and 3,3-dimethylbutan-2-one, affecting the product distribution between di- and trisubstituted methanes.

questions.question: What is the significance of the UUD conformation in the context of the new tris(diazene-N-oxide-N‘-hydroxylate) methanes?
questions.answer: The UUD conformation is significant because it demonstrates the base dependency of the reaction and is a new type of molecular propeller with correlated rotation around the C−N bonds.

questions.question: How does the presence of tert-butyl substituents or the ammonium cation affect the thermal decomposition properties of the salts?
questions.answer: The presence of tert-butyl substituents or the ammonium cation results in relatively mild exothermic decomposition compared to other salts.

questions.question: What is the effect of increasing N2O2- substitution on the 1H and 13C chemical shifts in methane compounds?
questions.answer: Increasing N2O2- substitution results in a general trend of shifting downfield for both 1H and 13C chemical shifts.

questions.question: What factors influence the formation of sodium methanetris(diazene-N-oxide-N‘-hydroxylate) as the main product in the reaction of acetone with nitric oxide?
questions.answer: The formation of sodium methanetris(diazene-N-oxide-N‘-hydroxylate) is influenced by the presence of sodium ethoxide, the reaction temperature, and the pressure of nitric oxide.

questions.question: Why does the reaction of nitric oxide with acetone and 3,3-dimethylbutan-2-one in the presence of lithium hydroxide result in different products compared to sodium and potassium hydroxide?
questions.answer: The reaction with lithium hydroxide results in different products due to the differential reactivity and stability of the mono-, bis-, and tris(diazene-N-oxide-N‘-hydroxylated) product formed towards hydrolytic cleavage.

questions.question: How does the choice of base affect the product distribution in the reaction of acetone with nitric oxide?
questions.answer: The choice of base affects the product distribution by influencing the competing hydrolytic reactions of the bis- and tris(diazene-N-oxide-N‘-hydroxylate) intermediates.

questions.question: What is the role of kinetic control in determining the product distribution between di- and trisubstituted methanes in the reaction of acetone with nitric oxide?
questions.answer: Kinetic control determines the product distribution between di- and trisubstituted methanes by affecting the rate at which competing reactions occur.

questions.question: Why are the tris(diazene-N-oxide-N‘-hydroxylate) products considered a new type of molecular propeller?
questions.answer: They are considered a new type of molecular propeller due to their unique conformational landscape and the correlated rotation of the N2O2- groups around the C−N bond.

questions.question: What factors contribute to the thermal instability of the N2O2- substituent?
questions.answer: The thermal instability of the N2O2- substituent is contributed by its electron withdrawing nature and the exothermic decomposition properties similar to other nitroxy substituents.

questions.question: True or False: The reaction of nitric oxide with acetone in the presence of sodium ethoxide at room temperature always results in sodium methanetris(diazene-N-oxide-N‘-hydroxylate) as the only product.
questions.answer: False

questions.question: True or False: The product distribution in the reaction of acetone with nitric oxide is solely determined by the temperature of the reaction.
questions.answer: False

questions.question: True or False: The UUD conformation is the only stable conformation for the new tris(diazene-N-oxide-N‘-hydroxylate) methanes.
questions.answer: False

questions.question: True or False: The presence of tert-butyl substituents or the ammonium cation has no effect on the thermal decomposition properties of the salts.
questions.answer: False

questions.question: True or False: Increasing N2O2- substitution does not affect the 1H and 13C chemical shifts in methane compounds.
questions.answer: False

questions.question: True or False: The reaction of nitric oxide with acetone and 3,3-dimethylbutan-2-one in the presence of lithium hydroxide yields the same products as when sodium or potassium hydroxide is used.
questions.answer: False

questions.question: True or False: The tris(diazene-N-oxide-N‘-hydroxylate) products undergo rapid hydrolysis in aqueous media.
questions.answer: True
